content:
MetaTable Class

Definition

Represents the metadata that describes a table for use by Dynamic Data pages.

In this Article

public class MetaTable
Inheritance
System.Object
MetaTable

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Constructors

MetaTable(MetaModel,TableProvider)

Initializes a new instance of the MetaTable class.

public MetaTable (System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel metaModel, System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.TableProvider tableProvider);
metaModel
MetaModel

The entity meta model.

tableProvider
TableProvider

The entity model provider.

Remarks

The tableProvider parameter is used to initialize the DataContextPropertyName property.

Properties

Attributes

Gets the attributes that are associated with the table.

public System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection Attributes { get; }
Value
AttributeCollection

A collection that contains the attributes of the table.

Columns

Gets the column collection for the table.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn> Columns { get; }
Value
ReadOnlyCollection<MetaColumn>

A collection that contains the columns for the table.

DataContextPropertyName

Gets the name of the table.

public string DataContextPropertyName { get; }
Value
String

The name of the table.

Remarks

The name comes from the DataContextType object that the table belongs to.

DataContextType

Gets the type of the data context that is associated with the table.

public Type DataContextType { get; }
Value
Type

The type of the data context.

Remarks

For more information, see the System.Data.Linq.DataContext class overview.

DisplayColumn

Gets the column that is used to display values when entries in this table are used as parents in foreign-key relationships.

public virtual System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn DisplayColumn { get; }
Value
MetaColumn

The column that is used to display values when entries in this table are used as parents in foreign-key relationships.

Remarks

The column that is returned is selected in this order:

  1. The column that is specified by using the DisplayColumnAttribute attribute.

  2. The first string column that is not in the primary key.

  3. The first string column that is in the primary key.

  4. The first non-string column that is in the primary key.

  5. The first column.

DisplayName

Gets the name of the table in a user-friendly format.

public virtual string DisplayName { get; }
Value
String

The string that represents the user-friendly name of the table.

Remarks

The value of this property defaults to the value of the Name property. You can customize the value of this property by using the System.ComponentModel.DisplayNameAttribute attribute.

EntityType

Gets the entity type that represents the table.

public Type EntityType { get; }
Value
Type

The type that represents the entity.

ForeignKeyColumnsNames

Gets a comma-separated list of foreign-key names.

public string ForeignKeyColumnsNames { get; }
Value
String

A comma-separated list of foreign-key names.

HasPrimaryKey

Gets a value that indicates whether the table has a primary key.

public bool HasPrimaryKey { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the table has a primary key; otherwise, false.

IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether the table is read-only.

public virtual bool IsReadOnly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the table is read-only; otherwise, false.

ListActionPath

Gets the action path of the list action for the table.

public string ListActionPath { get; }
Value
String

The action path of the list action for the table.

Remarks

The action path is a URL for an action for a specific entity. For more information, see the System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction class overview.

Model

Gets the meta model that the table belongs to.

public System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel Model { get; }
Value
MetaModel

The meta model that the table belongs to.

Remarks

For more information, see the System.Data.Linq.Mapping.MetaModel class overview.

Name

Gets the unique name of the table.

public string Name { get; }
Value
String

The unique name of the table.

PrimaryKeyColumns

Gets the collection of columns that define the primary key.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn> PrimaryKeyColumns { get; }
Value
ReadOnlyCollection<MetaColumn>

A collection that contains the primary-key columns.

Provider

Gets the provider for the table.

public System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.TableProvider Provider { get; }
Value
TableProvider

The provider for the table.

RootEntityType

Gets the root type of the entity's inheritance hierarchy.

public Type RootEntityType { get; }
Value
Type

The root type of the entity's inheritance hierarchy.

Remarks

If the type is at the top of the inheritance hierarchy or does not have a parent type, the entity type is returned.

Scaffold

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the table should be displayed.

public virtual bool Scaffold { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the table should be displayed; otherwise, false.

SortColumn

Gets the MetaColumn value that the table is sorted by.

public virtual System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn SortColumn { get; }
Value
MetaColumn

The column that the table is sorted by.

SortDescending

Gets a value that indicates whether entries are sorted in descending order when they are used as parents in a foreign-key relationship.

public virtual bool SortDescending { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if entries are sorted in descending order; otherwise, false.

Remarks

You can specify sort order by using the System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayColumnAttribute attribute.

Methods

BuildAttributeCollection()

Creates the attribute collection.

protected virtual System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection BuildAttributeCollection ();
Returns
AttributeCollection

The attribute collection.

CanDelete(IPrincipal)

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified user is allowed to perform delete operations.

public virtual bool CanDelete (System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal principal);
principal
IPrincipal

The user's security context.

Returns
Boolean

true if the user is allowed to perform delete operations; otherwise, false.

Remarks

A principal object represents the security context of the user on whose behalf the code is running, including that user's identity and any roles to which they belong.

CanInsert(IPrincipal)

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified user is allowed to perform insert operations.

public virtual bool CanInsert (System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal principal);
principal
IPrincipal

The user's security context.

Returns
Boolean

true if the user is allowed to perform insert operations; otherwise, false.

Remarks

A principal object represents the security context of the user on whose behalf the code is running, including that user's identity and any roles to which they belong.

CanRead(IPrincipal)

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified user is allowed to perform read operations.

public virtual bool CanRead (System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal principal);
principal
IPrincipal

The user's security context.

Returns
Boolean

true if the user is allowed to perform read operations; otherwise, false.

Remarks

A principal object represents the security context of the user on whose behalf the code is running, including that user's identity and any roles to which they belong.

CanUpdate(IPrincipal)

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified user is allowed to perform update operations.

public virtual bool CanUpdate (System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal principal);
principal
IPrincipal

The user's security context.

Returns
Boolean

true if the user is allowed to perform update operations; otherwise, false.

Remarks

A principal object represents the security context of the user on whose behalf the code is running, including that user's identity and any roles to which they belong.

CreateChildrenColumn(ColumnProvider)

Creates a new MetaChildrenColumn object.

protected virtual System.Web.DynamicData.MetaChildrenColumn CreateChildrenColumn (System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider columnProvider);
columnProvider
ColumnProvider

The column provider.

Returns
MetaChildrenColumn

The new child metacolumn object.

Remarks

This method can be overridden to create a derived type.

CreateColumn(ColumnProvider)

Creates a MetaColumn object.

protected virtual System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn CreateColumn (System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider columnProvider);
columnProvider
ColumnProvider

The column provider.

Returns
MetaColumn

The new metacolumn object.

Remarks

This method can be overridden to create a derived type.

CreateContext()

Returns the data context for the table.

public virtual object CreateContext ();
Returns
System.Object

The data context for the table.

Remarks

The data context is retrieved from a new context that is instantiated by calling the CreateContext method. For more information, see the System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable class overview.

CreateForeignKeyColumn(ColumnProvider)

Creates an object that contains foreign-key metadata.

protected virtual System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn CreateForeignKeyColumn (System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider columnProvider);
columnProvider
ColumnProvider

The column provider.

Returns
MetaForeignKeyColumn

An object that contains foreign-key metadata.

Remarks

This method can be overridden to create a derived type.

CreateTable(ICustomTypeDescriptor)

Creates the metadata for the specified table.

public static System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable CreateTable (System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor typeDescriptor);
typeDescriptor
ICustomTypeDescriptor

Information about the table type.

Returns
MetaTable

An object that contains the table metadata.

CreateTable(Type)

Creates the metadata for the specified table.

public static System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable CreateTable (Type entityType);
entityType
Type

The table type for which to generate metadata.

Returns
MetaTable

An object that contains the table metadata.

GetActionPath(String)

Returns the action path for the current table and the specified action.

public string GetActionPath (string action);
action
String

The name of the action.

Returns
String

The action path for the specified action.

GetActionPath(String,IList<Object>)

Returns the action path for the current table, specified action, and specified primary key.

public string GetActionPath (string action, System.Collections.Generic.IList<object> primaryKeyValues);
action
String

The name of the action.

primaryKeyValues
IList<Object>

The list of column values that make up the primary key.

Returns
String

The action path for the specified action and primary key.

Remarks

The action path is a URL for an action for a specific entity. For more information, see the System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction class overview.

GetActionPath(String,Object)

Returns the action path for the specified row by using the name of the action.

public string GetActionPath (string action, object row);
action
String

The name of the action.

row
System.Object

The row to get the action path for.

Returns
String

The action path for the specified row.

Remarks

The action path is a URL for an action for a specific entity. The action path contains the primary-key column names, which can be used for query-string filters.

For more information, see the System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction class overview.

GetActionPath(String,RouteValueDictionary)

Returns the action path for the current table and for the specified action and routes.

public string GetActionPath (string action, System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary routeValues);
action
String

The name of the action.

routeValues
RouteValueDictionary

The list of routes for the action.

Returns
String

The action path for the specified action and routes.

Remarks

The action path is a URL for an action for a specific entity. For more information, see the System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction class overview.

GetActionPath(String,IList<Object>,String)

Appends query strings to the action path, based on the specified primary key and virtual path.

public string GetActionPath (string action, System.Collections.Generic.IList<object> primaryKeyValues, string path);
action
String

The name of the action.

primaryKeyValues
IList<Object>

The list of column values that make up the primary key.

path
String

The virtual path of the action.

Returns
String

The action path for the specified primary key and virtual path, with query-string values appended to it.

Remarks

The action path is a URL for an action for a specific entity. For more information, see the System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction class overview.

GetActionPath(String,Object,String)

Returns the action path for the specified row by using the name of the action and the virtual path of the action.

public string GetActionPath (string action, object row, string path);
action
String

The name of the action.

row
System.Object

An object that contains the row for the action path.

path
String

The virtual path of the action.

Returns
String

The action path for the specified row.

Remarks

The action path is a URL for an action for a specific entity. For more information, see the System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction class overview.

GetColumn(String)

Returns the metadata for the specified column.

public System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn GetColumn (string columnName);
columnName
String

The name of the column to get metadata for.

Returns
MetaColumn

The column metadata.

GetColumnValuesFromRoute(HttpContext)

Gets the collection of column values.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,object> GetColumnValuesFromRoute (System.Web.HttpContext context);
context
HttpContext

The context for the specified Web request.

Returns
IDictionary<String,Object>

The collection of column values.

GetDataKeyFromRoute()

Retrieves the primary key of the entity from the route values.

public System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey GetDataKeyFromRoute ();
Returns
DataKey

The primary-key values of the entities, if they are found; otherwise, null.

Remarks

The route values typically come from the request URL query string.

GetDisplayString(Object)

Returns the value to use as the display string for an instance of a row when the row is used in foreign-key relationships.

public virtual string GetDisplayString (object row);
row
System.Object

The row to get the display string for.

Returns
String

The display name for an instance of a row.

Remarks

If the row is null, an empty string is returned. If the entity class includes an override of the ToString method, the overridden ToString value is returned. Otherwise, the method returns the ToString representation of the value of the DisplayColumn property for the specified row.

GetFilteredColumns()

Retrieves a list of columns that are filterable.

public virtual System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn> GetFilteredColumns ();
Returns
IEnumerable<MetaColumn>

A list of columns that are filterable.

Remarks

A column is filterable if it is annotated with the DisplayColumnAttribute attribute and the Enabled property of the <xref:System.Web.Mvc.FilterAttribute> attribute of the column is set to true.

GetPrimaryKeyDictionary(Object)

Retrieves a dictionary of primary-key names and values for the specified row.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,object> GetPrimaryKeyDictionary (object row);
row
System.Object

A row.

Returns
IDictionary<String,Object>

A dictionary of primary-key names and values.

GetPrimaryKeyString(IList<Object>)

Returns a comma-separated list of column values that represent the primary key for the specified row.

public string GetPrimaryKeyString (System.Collections.Generic.IList<object> primaryKeyValues);
primaryKeyValues
IList<Object>

The list of column values that make up the primary key.

Returns
String

A comma-separated list of column values. If the list is empty, an empty string is returned.

GetPrimaryKeyString(Object)

Returns a comma-separated list of column values that represent the primary key for the specified row.

public string GetPrimaryKeyString (object row);
row
System.Object

The row to get the primary key for.

Returns
String

A comma-separated list of column values that represent the primary key for the row.

GetPrimaryKeyValues(Object)

Returns a collection of column values that represent the primary key for the specified row.

public System.Collections.Generic.IList<object> GetPrimaryKeyValues (object row);
row
System.Object

The row to get the primary key for.

Returns
IList<Object>

A collection of column values that represent the primary key for the row.

GetQuery()

Returns the IQueryable instance for the entity type that represents the table.

public System.Linq.IQueryable GetQuery ();
Returns
IQueryable

The IQueryable instance for the entity type.

GetQuery(Object)

Returns the IQueryable instance for the entity type that represents the table by using the data context.

public virtual System.Linq.IQueryable GetQuery (object context);
context
System.Object

The context of the MetaTable object.

Returns
IQueryable

The IQueryable instance for the entity type that represents the table in the data context.

Remarks

If the context parameter is null, this method creates a new context by calling the CreateContext method.

GetScaffoldColumns(DataBoundControlMode,ContainerType)

Returns a list of columns to display by using scaffolding.

public virtual System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn> GetScaffoldColumns (System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControlMode mode, System.Web.DynamicData.ContainerType containerType);
mode
DataBoundControlMode

The data-bound control mode.

containerType
ContainerType

A value that indicates whether the table is displayed as an individual entity or as part of a list of entities.

Returns
IEnumerable<MetaColumn>

A list of columns to display by using scaffolding.

Remarks

This method returns all columns whose ScaffoldColumnAttribute property is set to true except the following:

  • Long string columns, which are columns whose IsLongString property is set to true and whose containerType parameter is true.

  • Child columns whose DataBoundControlMode value is set to DataBoundControlMode.

GetTable(Type)

Retrieves the metatable that is associated with the specified type.

public static System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable GetTable (Type entityType);
entityType
Type

The type of the entity.

Returns
MetaTable

The metatable that is associated with the specified type.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The stem.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable.TryGetTable(System.Type,System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable@) method that was called by this method returned false.

Remarks

This method calls TryGetTable(Type,MetaTable). If TryGetTable(Type,MetaTable) returns false, an InvalidOperationException exception is thrown.

Initialize()

Initializes data that may not be available when the constructor is called.

protected virtual void Initialize ();

Remarks

This method calls the Initialize method for each column in the MetaTable instance. This method cannot be called directly. To customize initialization, you can derive from this class and override the Initialize method. If you override this method, call the base control's Initialize method.

ResetMetadata()

Resets the cached metadata for the table.

public void ResetMetadata ();

Remarks

The cached table metadata consists of the information that is obtained from data-model attributes and from metadata about intrinsic columns. The metadata cache is rebuilt the next time any metadata is requested.

ToString()

Returns the name of the table.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

The name of the table.

TryGetColumn(String,MetaColumn)

Returns a value that indicates whether a specified column can be found.

public bool TryGetColumn (string columnName, out System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn column);
columnName
String

The name of the column to find.

column
MetaColumn

When this method returns, contains the MetaColumn object for columnName. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified column can be found; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If the columnName parameter is null, an InvalidOperationException exception is thrown.

TryGetTable(Type,MetaTable)

Retrieves the metatable that is associated with the specified type and table.

public static bool TryGetTable (Type entityType, out System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable table);
entityType
Type

The type of the entity.

table
MetaTable

When this method returns, contains the metatable that is associated with the specified type. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

Returns
Boolean

The metatable that is associated with the given specified and table.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

entityType is null.

rawMetadata.title: MetaTable class | Microsoft Docs
rawMetadata.description: Represents the metadata that describes a table for use by Dynamic Data pages.
